body.para: Thanks very much, that was it. I deactivated Personas and the scripts showed up again.

quote.quotepara: Greasemonkey 0.9.0 is incompatible with the Personas Firefox extension.
I am using Greasemonkey scripts for quite a while now and managed to write my own for a particular website.

Just today I wanted to check a script (not from me) that didn't seem to work anymore, so I chose (the German counterpart of)
"Extras->Greasemonkey->Organize scripts...". The Add-ons dialog opened, the
Greasemonkey user scripts "tab" was chosen, but the box with the dialog is empty.

But the user scripts work (except for the one I wanted to take care of), and if I open a website that has a user script defined, and I right click on the Greasemonkey icon in the status bar, the script shows up there.
My Greasemonkey version is 0.9.0, FF is 3.6.13
Does anybody know why this is? Is it a problem between the FF and the Greasemonkey version? I tried to search for a solution but haven't found anything helpful...
